name: Magical Traps
description: Traps that use magical energy, glyphs, or spells to harm or hinder intruders, often more versatile than mechanical traps
trigger: Varies - pressure plates, proximity, improper action, spoken word, specific creature type

damage.type: typically fire, but can be any magical damage type
damage.frequency: varies - some reset, some are single-use

savingThrow.ability: typically DEX, but can be any ability

duration: varies - instantaneous, resets, or ongoing effect

magicalTrapFeatures.detection: Can be detected with Detect Magic spell (shows school of magic)
magicalTrapFeatures.components: Often include magical glyphs or symbols
magicalTrapFeatures.effects: Can produce spell-like effects beyond simple damage
magicalTrapFeatures.versatility: Can target specific creature types or conditions

exampleTrap.name: Fire-Casting Statue
exampleTrap.trigger: Moving onto pressure plate or starting turn on it
exampleTrap.damage: 11 (2d10) Fire, DEX DC 15 save for half
exampleTrap.effect: Resets at start of next turn - can trigger repeatedly
exampleTrap.statue: Can look like anything (dragon, wizard, etc.)
detection: Detect Magic reveals Evocation aura around statue
DC 10 Wisdom (Perception) as Search action to spot tiny glyph on statue
DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) as Study action to recognize glyph means 'fire'
DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) as Search action to detect pressure plate
disarm: Deface glyph on statue with sharp tool (action)
Wedge Iron Spike under pressure plate

commonMagicalTrapTypes.description: Magical symbols that trigger spell effects
commonMagicalTrapTypes.detection: Detect Magic, Arcana checks to identify

commonMagicalTrapTypes.description: Release elemental energy (fire, lightning, cold, etc.)
Create illusions to confuse or misdirect
commonMagicalTrapTypes.detection: Detect Magic shows Illusion school, Investigation to disbelieve

method: Detect Magic spell (reveals aura and school of magic)
Wisdom (Perception) for glyphs, statues, or unusual features
Intelligence (Arcana) to identify magical symbols and their meaning
Intelligence (Investigation) for pressure plates and mechanisms

mitigation: Cast Detect Magic to identify magical traps
Use Dispel Magic to disable magical effects (if applicable)
Have proficiency in Arcana to identify and understand glyphs
Deface or destroy magical components (glyphs, focus items)
Use Counterspell if trap casts a spell
Have Resistance or Immunity to expected damage type
Trigger trap from safe distance using objects or summons
Use Antimagic Field to suppress magical traps (extreme measure)
designConsiderations: Magical traps often more expensive to create than mechanical traps
Can be more versatile in targeting and effects
May require spellcaster to create originally
Often found in wizard towers, temples, and magical vaults
Can have ongoing effects (guardians, lasting enchantments)
Some deactivate when creator dies, others remain indefinitely
Can be keyed to allow specific creatures to pass safely

spells: Glyph of Warding: Creates trap with spell effect
Symbol: Powerful trap affecting multiple creatures
Magic Mouth: Can warn intruders or trigger other effects
creationNotes.time: Can take hours to days depending on complexity
creationNotes.permanence: Some traps are permanent, others have duration

srdReference.quote: A Detect Magic spell reveals an aura of Evocation magic around the statue. As a Search action, a creature within 5 feet of the statue can examine it and make a DC 10 Wisdom (Perception) check, detecting a tiny glyph on the statue on a successful check.

examples: Statue breathing fire when pressure plate triggered
Glyph of Warding on door casting Fireball at intruders
Symbol spell causing Fear in unauthorized creatures
Illusory bridge over pit revealed by Investigation
Animated armor guardian awakening when treasure touched
Lightning bolt shooting from wall when wrong key used
